full_text: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Public Information Office Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 353 (b)(6) (b)(7)(C) (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) 7/25/2019 10:54 AM >>> (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) This is a heads up that our public affairs office, IPPA leadership, and the Director's office drafted a statement for all Epstein inquiries today that DOJ's public affairs folks are now reviewing. USMS will also see it because they are getting media inquiries and called me. And DOJ's Legislative Affairs team as well as BOP's legislative affairs folks are getting Congressional interest (Members' offices saying we should take better care of him, etc.). The final response to media that will be approved by DOJ should be given to me within the hour and I will send it out to more than 30 reporters who've emailed me. I'll give the response to (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) who can give it to media who've contacted him in Lee's absence (Lee also has been in touch with me to be sure I have all I need). I'll send you all the final approved response from DOJ when I get it. Thanks (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Public Information Office Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 353 (b)(6) (b)(7)(C) (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Page 4601 DOJ-OGR-00024381

text_blocks.content: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Public Information Office Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 353 (b)(6) (b)(7)(C)

This is a heads up that our public affairs office, IPPA leadership, and the Director's office drafted a statement for all Epstein inquiries today that DOJ's public affairs folks are now reviewing. USMS will also see it because they are getting media inquiries and called me. And DOJ's Legislative Affairs team as well as BOP's legislative affairs folks are getting Congressional interest (Members' offices saying we should take better care of him, etc.).

The final response to media that will be approved by DOJ should be given to me within the hour and I will send it out to more than 30 reporters who've emailed me. I'll give the response to (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) who can give it to media who've contacted him in Lee's absence (Lee also has been in touch with me to be sure I have all I need).
I'll send you all the final approved response from DOJ when I get it.
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Public Information Office Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 353 (b)(6) (b)(7)(C) (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)

additional_notes: The document contains multiple redactions, indicated by (b)(6), (b)(7)(C), which suggests that the document has been processed under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) or a similar law. The redactions are likely related to personal privacy or law enforcement information.
